positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description:
Organize, coordinate, and lead company-wide transformation projects. Establish company-wide standards. Coordinate continuous updates and maintenance of existing standards. Contribute to tooling utilized by all developers within company.

Utilize programming languages like C# to develop web APIs, schedule-based jobs, and web applications, and C++ to maintain and modernize legacy solutions. Develop solutions to interact with internal code bases, as well as third party applications for tax calculation, payment processing, and other financial activities.

Architect solutions to ensure the handling of load of 1 million requests or more per day. Develop and execute test cases, utilizing automated testing in CI/CD pipeline wherever possible. Implement monitoring, logging, and error handling.

Practice SCRUM on a team of 11 people.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description:
Utilize programming languages like C# to develop web APIs, schedule-based jobs, and web applications, and C++ to maintain and modernize legacy solutions. positions.title: Computer Science Tutor
positions.description: Coach and mentor students in Computer Information Systems field, motivate students, assist in evaluating studying techniques and learning styles, build relationships with students and colleagues with diverse backgrounds, and model professional academic behavior.

positions.title: Tech Service Assistant
positions.description: Assist the IT Department with staff requests, wipe old computers and image new ones to swap out, troubleshoot problems with current hardware and software, and communicate with IT employees and St. Scholastica staff.

positions.title: Web Assistant
positions.description: Created, modified, and analyzed websites used in the CIS 1001 course on campus, created scripts for automatic quiz generation from a Google Sheet, troubleshooted bugs in website/systems.

projects.name: SqliteMemoryDatabaseProvider
projects.description: NuGet package for .NET 6.0 and above applications for creating in-memory SQLite databases to be used within unit tests. Follows <u>[Microsoft's documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/testing/testing-without-the-database#sqlite-in-memory)</u> on how to create unit testing without using a production database system, but doesn't require all the boilerplate outlined in the documentation for consumers.

projects.name: EntityFrameworkCore.Concurrency
projects.description: NuGet package for .NET 6.0 and above applications for handling concurrency conflicts in EntityFramework.

projects.name: Better Money Manager
projects.description: A desktop application for managing finances. Frontend using Tauri (Rust) and UI using Blazor WebAssembly. State management using Flux.

projects.name: MultiDiary
projects.description: Simple but powerful journal app. Built using .NET and Maui.

projects.name: Personal Website
projects.description: Personal website created using .NET and Blazor WebAssembly.

projects.name: CLI Tools
projects.description: Lightweight CLI tools built using Rust.

projects.name: Wedding Website
projects.description: Wedding website for my wedding. Built using .NET and Blazor (Server and Client). Hosted in Docker.

projects.name: Home Assistant Automations
projects.description: Various automations for my home. Built using Python and AppDaemon. Includes limited testing using pytest.
